entry.title: Transformative Lessons from SAP NOW AI Tour Argentina
entry.content:
On August 28th, SAP brought its renowned SAP NOW AI Tour to Argentina, offering a unique opportunity for local professionals to engage with cutting-edge AI innovations. We had the honor of participating in sessions where more than 1,000 experts shared their innovative ideas, experiences, and case studies. The event featured an extensive catalogue of talks, covering a wide range of topics related to various fields of interest regarding AI, ensuring there was something valuable for everyone. In the following sections, I will share my personal insights and reflections on the talks I attended and the overall event.

Reflecting on the occasion, the word that comes to mind is "transformative" due to the profound impact of the event. On one hand, it was a huge source of inspiration: new ideas, visions, interesting strategies, and personal experiences were shared. On the other hand, it provided practical insights through real cases and projects. This means that all the experts were capable of delivering not only an aspirational message, but also some proof that served as a truthful outcome.

One of the strongest ideas presented during the event was the notion of a virtuous circle created by the integration of applications, data, and artificial intelligence. We were shown how these elements, when working together, can generate outcomes that are more resilient, more sustainable, and more efficient. What struck me the most is that this perspective positioned AI not as something external or distant, but as an element that can and should be embedded into our everyday processes. For a company like ours, this confirmed that the future of AI lies in making it part of the very foundation of the business.

Another highlight was seeing Joule, and the different ways in which it is already being applied. We learned that it has the potential to simplify a great portion of repetitive tasks, allowing teams to dedicate their time and creativity to areas that truly generate value. 

Finally, the reflections on responsible AI gave the sessions a deeper meaning. Beyond the technical demonstrations, there was a constant reminder of the importance of building systems that are transparent and trustworthy. For me, this emphasis on ethics was essential: it reminded us that innovation must go hand in hand with accountability, especially when the goal is to design solutions that people will rely on every day. 

Despite the diversity of experts and talks, a common theme emerged: there is no single correct way to achieve success. The real challenge is to find the method, the technique, the strategy that best works for you. About the topic, experts at the event encouraged us to take advantage of all the tools and resources available to build an efficient ecosystem that adapts to our needs and showcases our uniqueness.

Connected with what was said above, this phrase resonated with me the most: you have to pluck up the courage and just do things. Success is the best teacher for failure. In order to succeed in something, it is necessary to conceive the idea of failing as something inevitable – and indispensable – and to include it within the planning towards a goal. Otherwise, the frustration will be not only unbearable, but we will forget about how important it is for our progress. Where would we take the valuable lessons from, if not from failing time after time? Consider this: if you are not experiencing failures, it might indicate that you are not challenging yourself or progressing. A lack of failure could mean that you are stuck in the same place.

And what about you? Have you attended the SAP AI Tour yet? When is it coming to your city? Have you learned anything that has impacted the way you view AI? What are your expectations if you are planning to attend this event in the future?

entry.title: SAP S/4HANA Cloud for group reporting - Release 2508 is generally available
entry.content:
We’re continuing our strategic investment in group reporting to simplify financial closing, enhance user experience, and accelerate your consolidation process. Today, we’re pleased to announce the release of SAP S/4HANA Cloud for group reporting version 2508 launched on August 18, 2025. This latest release introduces powerful new features and integrates business AI capabilities into your software.

Key new and enhanced features in 2508 include:

  • Integration of Joule, our AI copilot, in group reporting
  • AI-assisted insights for group financial statement review booklet
  • Integration with SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC)
  • New consolidation auto post rules engine app
  • One-click consolidation in a new consolidation monitor app
  • Customer-defined sign convention
  • Accountant-friendly display of manual journal entries in debit-credit
  • Integration of balance validations and notifications in GRDC package
  • Export questions and answers from GRDC forms
  • Ability to enter or load reported data for dimension totals
  • Cross-version validations and dynamic version comparison in analytics
  • And many more improvements on data collection, data quality, analytics and master data

Download our feature deck.

-
Integration of Joule, our AI copilot, in Group Reporting

Joule is SAP’s AI copilot - leveraging its generative AI capabilities, Joule aims to understand your requests, retrieve information, and complete your tasks in a conversational way. For example, instead of manually navigating to a feature or page buried deep, you can describe the current task to Joule, who can help automate tasks or take you to places where you can find desired data. By using Joule, you can easily interact with the system and increase your productivity.

Group Reporting now integrates with two Joule capabilities.

Since June 2025, Group Reporting integrates with Joule's informational capability. This conversational search capability helps you retrieve necessary information from the SAP Help Portal or documents uploaded to the Joule service if you've set up Document Grounding. Joule searches available Group Reporting documentation and it's own knowledge base to find the answer to your query and summarizes the search results and provides the summarization as the answer to your question, along with the top three search results.

Released in version 2508, Joule’s navigational capability is now integrated in Group Reporting. This capability helps you find and navigate to the Group Reporting functionality or apps you're looking for without having to go through multiple links to reach a destination. ​With Joule, you can easily navigate across Group Reporting with navigational interactions. ​Joule offers a navigational link that opens the relevant app and interface in a new browser tab. At the destination, you can continue from where you left off, with your previous conversation history.

Below is an example of navigation with Joule in Group Reporting. You're finished working on exchange rates (1), and tell Joule you'd "like to see group journal entry" (2) . Our AI copilot proposes three possible apps either to post or display journal entries. As you want to create a new journal entry, you just select the Post Group Journal Entries app and (3) Joule opens it.

More information: Joule informational capability, Document grounding, Joule navigational capability

-
AI-assisted insights for group financial statement review booklet

With version 2508, you can now use AI-generated analyses and summaries of your data in the Group Financial Statements Review Booklet app. You can use AI-assisted business insights for the Profit & Loss (nature of expense) and access it in the side panel. Based on the data displayed, you can do the following AI-assisted analyses: bottom-line growth, EBIT, EBITDA, financial result, operating income/loss, profitability, top-line growth and currency variance.

Business insights combine drilldown and filter actions with AI prompts, accessing large language model in SAP Business Technology Platform. They automate navigation and provide you with explanations of the data. Business insights answer predefined business questions and provides you with summarized information on your financial statements. In addition, you'll soon be able to leverage AI-assisted insights to summarize the comments in your financial statements (this innovation is planned for version 2508.1).

More information: AI-Assisted Business Insights in 'Group Financial Statements Review Booklet' App

-
Integration with SAP Business Data Cloud

SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC) leverages our extensive portfolio of business applications and our customers’ diverse data architectures to create a unified, semantically rich data environment built on a single semantic model. This environment serves as the data foundation for our AI-First strategy and is planned to become the preferred gateway for customers to extract data from SAP and non-SAP systems.

As depicted in the diagram below, in addition to the integration with BDC Analytics Cloud, in 2025 we strengthened Group Reporting integration with BDC by delivering content for Datasphere and integrating Group Reporting Data Collection (GRDC) with Datasphere.

 

Delivered in Q1-2025, the Group Reporting content in Datasphere allows to perform reporting on consolidated data within BDC. The content package includes the following (see screenshot below):

  • Extraction of Group Reporting master data
  • Extraction of Group Reporting raw transactional data
  • Group Reporting logic built in SAP Datasphere

The data model is implemented based on the data structures used in Group Reporting and leverages standard CDS views to extract and load data. It covers among others version relations including extension versions, group derivation logic based on group structure as well as hierarchy elimination. With the help of this content package, you can integrate your Group Reporting data with other data sets within Datasphere. Please note the reporting items and reporting rules are not yet be part of the content. We plan to remove this restriction together with this related innovation on reporting rules.

In September 2025 with version 2508.2, we'll deliver BDC integration in Group Reporting Data Collection (GRDC). With this new feature, you can use Datasphere as a source in your data mapping definition. You have the ability to load data from Datasphere into Group Reporting with GRDC mapping. You can define new sources for Datasphere models, and use defined sources in GRDC. 

More information: Group Reporting content in Datasphere, Datasphere integration in GRDC

-
New consolidation auto post rules engine

You now benefit from a new rule engine to automate your consolidation postings. This engine is inspired by SAP Financial Consolidation and aims to offer the same level of power and flexibility valued by its users. 

We increased flexibility of the rule definition compared to existing consolidation rules:

  • Flexible definition of source data
  • Assignment of multiple document types in one task
  • Multiple posting lines
  • Flexible definition of the target data (field assignment, value calculation)
  • Inclusion of the results of previous rule steps as an option
  • Enhanced partner filter for intra-unit eliminations
  • Field Assignment option Value Of to post on partner fields
  • Inclusion of Rules to Nodes and Rule Groups
  • Flexible assignment of Rule Groups to the Tasks
  • Modern Task Log

Since June 2025, you can leverage our new rule engine to automate postings for consolidation units for local close (posting levels 00, 0C, 01, 10). Check out here for more information.

With version 2508, you can now also use our new rule engine to automate inter-unit eliminations for pairwise elimination (posting level 20). This feature enables you to automatically post group journal entries for pairs of consolidation units by running consolidation tasks in the consolidation monitor. It allows you to eliminate intercompany transactions, such as sales, other income/expenses, and accounts receivable/accounts payable, for example. 

As we move forward in 2025, we plan to release incremental innovations to automate consolidation group–related postings in the consolidation monitor on posting level 30, and replace reclassifications on posting level 30 (see our roadmap). 

More information:

  • Manage Rules for Automatic Postings
  • Assign Rule Groups for Automatic Postings
  • Display Logs for Automatic Postings
  • Import/Export Current Settings
  • Automatic Postings for Pairs of Consolidation Units
  • Automate consolidation group–related postings | SAP Roadmap 

-
One-click consolidation in a new consolidation monitor app

Available since June 2025, we deliver a new version of the Consolidation Monitor. You can now work in a modern user interface powered by the latest Fiori technology, including features like filtering and sorting.

To enhance your closing process experience, you're able to perform several actions with just one click – for example, you can carry out a full consolidation or open and close periods effortlessly (see the screenshot below). You can improve usability by switching from the existing app to this new version with its updated interface. You're able to increase efficiency by performing actions across multiple values, including tasks, groups, and periods. Additionally, you can streamline operations by opening or closing multiple periods, running full consolidations, and automating task processing through task scheduling.

More information: One-click consolidation in a new consolidation monitor app

-
Customer-defined sign convention

From 2508.1 release, planned in September 2025, you'll be able to define your own sign logic, instead of the SAP sign logic. The SAP sign logic interprets positive amounts for each financial statement item as debit amounts and negative amounts as credit amounts. For instance, revenue is stored as a negative amount. With 2508.1, you can specify if the financial statement items should be posted as debit amounts or credit amounts.

​You can select the default sign behavior of your financial statement items:

  • Debit item: a positive number is a debit
  • Credit item: a positive number is a credit

For example, you can opt for the following sign convention:

  • Assets are debit financial statement items: gross values are entered as positive amounts; amortization, depreciation and impairment are entered as negative amounts
  • Equity & liabilities are credit: amounts are entered as positive amounts
  • Income statement are credit: revenues are entered as positive amounts, expenses as negative amounts

In this example, the movements (subitems) behave as follows:

  • Assets /Gross values and Equity & Liabilities: increases are entered as positive amounts, decreases
    as negative amounts
  • Assets /Amort. Depr. & Impairment: increases are entered as negative amounts, decreases as positive
    amount

More information: Configurable sign convention for data inputs and data processing  

-
Accountant-friendly display of manual journal entries in debit-credit

Available since June 2025, we enhanced the usability of the "Post Group Journal Entries" app. You can choose to enter manual group journals with a Debit/Credit indicator and sign-free amounts. When you activate this new layout, the manual journal entry is more accountant-oriented. This new feature changes only the display of the journals; it doesn’t change the way they're stored in the database. It's also applied to previously posted journals.

More information: Debit/Credit Indicator in the Manual Group Journal Entries Apps 

-
Integration of balance validations and notifications in GRDC package

We continue to deliver on the integration of the Data Monitor capabilities in Group Reporting Data Collection (GRDC) package. In addition to the integration of the release, data collection, annual net income and line validation tasks, in 2508 you can now benefit from the balance validation task integration in your package. With this integration, you're able to control the consistency of your consolidation unit reported data directly in the package.

Typical balance validations in GRDC include:

  • Assets equal Equity and Liabilities
  • Gross value of assets higher or equal to depreciation and impairment
  • Exhaustive breakdown of investment in subsidiaries by shares
  • Complete analysis of investment in subsidiaries, net equity or assets and liabilities by movements

You can use balance validations effectively in a staggered consolidation approach, where you use GRDC to collect data step by step in a phased manner. You define multiple data entry steps within a package. Each step targets a specific type of data and validations (like P&L, Balance Sheet, Intercompany, or Disclosures) and you're able to schedule them in a specific order. This lets you validate and complete each phase before moving to the next, ensuring data quality and control throughout the close process.

In addition, you can now receive notifications for the tasks you run for a package in the GRDC Enter Package Data app. These notifications keep you informed about the status and progress of your tasks, for example, reported data validation task. The task can be underway or completed successfully, with warning or with errors (see screenshot below).

More information: GRDC - Integrate balance validation task into the package, and receive notifications 

-
Export questions and answers from GRDC forms

In 2508.2, you'll be able to export all Q&A and text entered in GRDC Forms via the new Export Questions and Answers app.

When you add questions to your Forms, you collect additional textual information that becomes part of the financial data submitted to the Group. With the new Export Q&A to CSV function, you can easily extract all responses and use them for deeper insights, reporting, or decision-making. This makes it easier for you to work with qualitative data alongside your financial results.

Exporting Q&A is simple. Just follow these steps:

  1. Open the Export Package Data app.
  2. Use the filters at the top to select the Package you want to export.
  3. Click the Create QA Export button. You’ll see the progress in the task list.
  4. Once the task is finished, a Download button will appear.
  5. Click the Download button to save the CSV file directly to your desktop.

More information: Export Q&A from GRDC

-
Ability to enter or load reported data for dimension totals

With version 2508, when you upload data (using the GRDC Data Mapping or Import Reported Data apps) or when you input data manually (in the GRDC Enter Package Data app) you can now choose to activate the Total Mode option to load reported data with some missing dimension values. The total value of such a dimension is then aggregated without changing the existing values of the same dimension.

For example, this new feature helps you to load a provisional balance sheet without breaking it down into subitems that can contain the details of a functional transaction type. The balance carry forward has already filled the opening subitem and this value will not change when the balance sheet is loaded. Instead, the delta is calculated and saved in a standard transaction type.

Here's an example of how you can load data using the new Total Mode option - here, in GRDC Data Mapping.

(1) On the opening balance, consolidation unit "CU001 - France" has a detail of 500 € on partner "CU002 - Germany" for the financial item 121190 - Trade receivables.

(2) Intercompany on Trade receivables is now 700 €, and is imported with GRDC Data Mapping.

(3) With the Total Mode option, 200 € is automatically stored on the variation movement.

The uploaded amount of 700 is handled as a total. A delta amount of 200 between the uploaded amount of 700 on subitem 915 and the already present amount of 500 on subitem 900 is written to subitem 915 for FS item 121190 and partner CU002.

More information: Create Totals for Reported Data with Missing Dimension Values

-
Other innovations

Master data

  • Customer changes of SAP pre-defined selection objects are now supported
  • Parent method change in the Manage Group Structure app for activity-based consolidation of investments

Data collection

  • Multi-tab management in GRDC package
  • Decimal places for quantities based on unit of measure in GRDC package
  • New sign convention in data source import option of GRDC data mapping to adhere to customer sign convention
  • Enhanced documentation for changed treatment of product group in the release universal journal

Data quality and governance

  • New user roles to refine modification and access rights on GRDC data mapping definitions and jobs
  • Ability to generate/save a traceability log for each unique data mapping context in GRDC data mapping
  • New option to overwrite rule control level in line-item validations 
  • Automation of data collection control via control fields substitution in the activity-based consolidation of investments 

Analytics

  • Cross-version validations and dynamic version comparison in analytics

-
More information

  • Group reporting 2508 feature deck
  • Group reporting 2508 help portal
  • Recap of group reporting new features
  • Group reporting community
  • Group reporting customer influence platform

entry.title: What's New for Joule in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud-2508
entry.content:
Hi Community,

Here is a blog post of What's New features introduced in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud 2508 edition in the exciting world of SAP Joule.

New use cases now supported

Joule now enables you to view business data of many SAP objects like Process order , Solution order, Enterprise project , Inspection methods , Work Centers and many more...

Update Delivery Date for Purchase Orders

Joule enables you, as a purchaser, to update delivery dates for purchase orders.

For example, when suppliers or equivalent sources inform you of delays or changes, you can use Joule to update the delivery dates with the new information.

Checking sales order fulfillment status

Joule allows you to check whether a sales order's fulfillment is on track and identify the issues that block its fulfillment. For each sales order, Joule can tell whether such issues exist in the order processing phase. If yes, you can display issue details, view possible causes and handling suggestions for each issue, and navigate to related apps.

Expiring Prices Handling

Joule now enables you to manage expiring prices (stored as condition records for pricing in sales) in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. With Joule, you can fetch prices that will expire soon, extend their valid-to dates, and adjust their condition amounts or ratios as you need.

Electronic Document Error Explanations

The Manage Electronic Documents app now enables natural language interaction with Joule, making it easier to understand electronic document exchange errors. You can ask Joule for error explanations and recommended resolution steps. By providing detailed insights, SAP Joule helps you understand the root cause of errors and offers guidance on corrective actions.

There are many more features which can be explored by clicking on the What's New Viewer link https://help.sap.com/docs/joule/capabilities-guide/what-s-new-for-joule-capabilities

Thanks!!!

Explore the SAP Business AI features with SAP Joule.

Regards

Shubham

Joule SAP Business AI SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

entry.title: Understanding CNNs (Convolutional Neural Networks) in under 5 minutes
entry.content:
AI isn’t a dream of the future anymore; it’s all around us. With countless acronyms and concepts to grasp, one you can’t afford to ignore if you want to thrive at consulting is CNN, as it’s reshaping how companies operate and create value in digital economies. 

In this quick guide, we’ll break down what CNNs are, why they matter, and how you can start building the skills to bring this knowledge into your consulting career. 

👉Read through to the end for a resource that will help you take the first step in developing these skills. 

 
So, What is a CNN?  

A CNN (Convolutional Neural Network) is a type of deep brain network that takes hints from how we see. Inspired by the way human brains interpret visual signals, it spots lines, edges, shapes, and patterns. Unlike the “old brain” webs that "see" each bit alone, CNNs can keep track of where things are. This helps them deal with big sets of pics, clips, etc.  

Why Convolutional? Well, the CNNs maintain spatial relationships by using layers called “convolutions” Read more here 

How does a CNN run? (In 3 steps) 

  • The “Convolutional Layer” has three components: the input, which is an image, a kernel (also known as a filter) to detect features like lines, edges, or colors; and an output, which is a feature map summarizing the features found.   
  • The “Pooling Layer”: This layer simplifies the size of the feature map, keeping only the most important information.   
  • The “Fully Connected” Layer takes all that information and uses it to perform classification or regression tasks

What is the difference between CNN and DNN?  

  • A DNN, Deep Neural Network, is an “AI brain web” with lots of links. It sees facts piece by piece, making it good for tasks like seeing pics, hearing speech, & dealing with words.  
  • CNN is a kind of specialized DNN, well-suited for handling image data. The key difference is the ability to apply filters to the input image to extract key features. The information extracted through these layers is then passed to “fully connected layers,” which analyze the features and can generate predictions.   

 

 The big gap is what they do best: DNNs are all-around and work with many kinds of tasks. CNNs are top at jobs that need seeing & knowing visual facts.   

What are CNNs mainly used for

Tasks with Pics  

CNNs work well at sorting, classifying, and detecting objects in images. They have transformed how companies manage visual information: from predictive maintainance tasks in manufacturing to smart supply chain management.  

Dealing with Docs  

CNNs are widely used to automate the extraction of information from documents such as invoices, receipts, and contracts. Instead of relying on manual work or rigid rule-based systems, CNNs can identify and capture key data pointssuch as dates, monetary values, and vendor names with higher accuracy and speed. This also reduces human error, streamlines workflows, and ensures more reliable data for follow-up processes. 

Seeing Things Early  

As said, CNNs are great for looking at things. And they are the perfect ally in enterprise contexts to “see things early”. CNNs can help look at data coming from equipment and machinery, for instance, and detect patterns and anomalies that signal possible failures. This potentially cuts costs & keeps work smooth.  

CNNs in the SAP Ecosystem

The integration of Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) and other advanced AI technologies within SAP Business AI  is reshaping how businesses run and their competitiveness. 

This means clients will increasingly expect you to explain not only the technology, but also the business value it creates. By embedding artificial intelligence into foundational business systems, SAP enables enterprises to enhance operational efficiency, leverage data-driven insights, and drive sustained innovation. As the company continues to evolve its AI offerings, consultants who can connect these capabilities to business outcomes will be the ones helping organizations achieve long-term success in an increasingly competitive marketplace. 

👉If you want to kickstart your career in consulting, explore the SAP Young Professionals Program,  an initiative designed to upskill young talent in SAP’s latest solutions and prepare them as Associate Consultants, ready to deliver value across the SAP ecosystem.

entry.title: ABAP AI - Chapter 2
entry.content:
Summary

  • New ABAP AI capabilities keep coming
  • Joule for Developers, ABAP AI capabilities remain free of charge
  • Availability of ABAP AI in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition in release 2025 is ahead of us
  • ABAP AI will be available in older releases of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition as well, details and updates expected at TechEd.

In February 2025, we started the first chapter of ABAP AI and announced that Joule speaks ABAP. Now, it’s time to get ready for chapter 2!

In the past months, we have been delivering more Joule skills to speed up ABAP Cloud development, and we are now able to create RAP business objects – from the database table up to the UI service powered by generative AI. We can create unit tests, explain code, complete code in the editor, implement validations and determinations, and much more (see also our public slide deck). All these skills are part of the 2508 release of SAP BTP ABAP Environment and SAP Cloud ERP (SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition), and they will be included in the SAP Cloud ERP Private (SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition) in the 2025 release. Please check out our updated tutorial on ABAP AI capabilities. In addition, we will continue to expand our AI scope and will deliver on the transformation aspect of our AI strategy. This starts with the 2025 delivery for SAP Cloud ERP Private, followed by AI capabilities in the custom code migration app in SAP BTP ABAP Environment 2602. Please visit our roadmap to keep track of our deliveries.

Let’s continue with commercials and keep it short: The free promotions we introduced at the beginning of the year have been extended until further notice! We are convinced that, in the current situation, we don’t want to put any commercial barriers on our offering and let all customers and partners benefit from AI-driven development. The corresponding material numbers for customers 8019124 and TDD partners 8019541 remain the same and can be ordered again. For those who started before the extension of the promotion, note that a re-ordering of the material is required. The procedure for the SAP BTP ABAP Environment and SAP Cloud ERP remains the same as well, and the initial blog post has been updated to reflect this, as well as SAP Note 3571857.
For SAP Cloud ERP Private, as of release 2025, the material numbers are also valid. However, the configuration will need to be done manually by you. Detailed information on this will follow.

But that is not enough. Will ABAP AI capabilities become available also for older releases of SAP Cloud ERP Private? Yes!
Imagine an ABAP AI service running side-by-side to your ABAP instance, providing full access to ABAP AI capabilities across hybrid landscapes. This includes SAP BTP ABAP Environment, SAP Cloud ERP, and SAP Cloud ERP Private. New AI innovations become available independently of release upgrades or support packages, allowing immediate leveraging.  Best of all, this ABAP AI service can also be connected to older releases of SAP Cloud ERP Private.

Sounds like a dream? Let’s find out – stay tuned for TechEd 2025 to receive all the news and updates!

entry.title: 🚀 SAP BTP Weekly: Practical AI, Enhanced Analytics, and a Vision for the Future
entry.content:
1. Joule Studio and No-Code AI Agents
Creating intelligent agents without coding is now possible in SAP Build. This opens the door for both business and IT teams to build copilots that answer questions and automate tasks quickly.

Beyond the no-code hype, the challenge is cultural: will users trust an internally developed agent? Imagine a procurement team building an agent to negotiate with suppliers—it speeds up the process, but what if the agent misinterprets company policies? Human oversight remains essential.

🔗 https://www.sap.com/spain/products/artificial-intelligence/joule-studio.html 

2. Joule for Consultants
A new program helps SAP consultants use Joule as a copilot during implementations. It includes guides, templates, and real-world use cases that can be applied directly to client projects.

The potential lies in reducing configuration time and accelerating deployments. But it also raises questions: to what extent will Joule replace manual tasks? For example, in a SuccessFactors project, it could generate initial configurations within minutes—though expert validation will always be required.

🔗 https://www.sap.com/spain/products/artificial-intelligence/ai-assistant/sap-consulting-capability.html 

3. Integration with Event Mesh and Kafka
SAP Advanced Event Mesh now connects with Apache Kafka, enabling hybrid and decentralized architectures. This allows for more resilient micro-integrations compared to traditional point-to-point models.

The practical challenge lies in governance. A retail company might use it to synchronize inventories across multiple channels in seconds, but managing topics and ensuring traceability can become complex. SAP provides connectors, but the learning curve is real.

🔗 https://events.sap.com/eur-expertsession-aemkafka/en_us/home.html 

4. Real-World FinOps on BTP
Companies adopting FinOps on BTP are gaining visibility and achieving up to 20% reductions in cloud costs. Dashboards and alerts help CIOs and CFOs make faster decisions.

The challenge is organizational: finance and IT often “speak different languages.” Imagine a telco optimizing Integration Suite consumption—without internal agreements, discussions about who pays what can escalate. The technology is ready, governance isn’t always.

🔗 https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/enhanced-finops-capabilities-for-sap-btp/ba-p/14113797 

5. SAP Build Process Automation
New preconfigured processes allow automation of HR, compliance, and finance tasks in days. A “shortcut” for organizations seeking efficiency without large-scale projects.

The tricky part is resistance to change. An HR team may see value in automating vacation approvals, but users often fear losing control. SAP provides ready-to-use processes, but tailoring them to each organization still requires effort.

🔗 https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/public-site-for-sap-build-pre-built-content/ba-p/13562272 

6. BDC and Databricks: Next-Generation Analytics
The integration between SAP BTP Data & Analytics (BDC) and Databricks enables unification of SAP and non-SAP data in lakehouse environments for AI and advanced analytics.

Picture a mining company combining SAP financial data with IoT sensor data in Databricks: the predictive potential is enormous. The challenge lies in governance: without a clear model, “data democratization” can turn into chaos. SAP ensures traceability, but governance is each organization’s responsibility.

🔗 https://news.sap.com/2025/02/sap-databricks-open-bold-new-era-data-ai/ 

7. SAP Now Argentina – Business Highlights
The event showcased how local companies are applying SAP BTP and Joule to real business processes. Applied AI was the highlight, with use cases in retail, energy, and manufacturing.

Beyond the excitement, scalability remains a question. Can a successful pilot in one area be extended across the entire organization? Use cases inspire, but customers still need clarity on timelines and adoption costs.

🔗 https://www.sap.com/products/data-cloud/databricks.html 

8. SAP Customer Success Day – Our Experience
This week we had the privilege of meeting with over 20 customers in an exclusive workshop on enterprise integration, exploring the power of SAP BTP Advanced Event Mesh (AEM) and SAP Integration Suite.

Beyond the technology, what stood out was how different customers face similar challenges: shifting from point-to-point to event-driven models without losing control or simplicity. A bank raised the need to process thousands of transactions in real time; a retail company sought to orchestrate omnichannel inventory. Everyone agreed the key is not just the tool, but the ability to redesign processes.

🔗 https://www.linkedin.com/feed/update/urn:li:activity:7369726725749903369/ 

At the end of the day, BTP is experienced differently depending on the role: for a CIO it’s efficiency and control, for an architect it’s integration, for a Basis administrator it’s security, and for a consultant it’s delivery speed. Yet ultimately, we all face the same question: how do we create real business value from technology without getting lost in complexity?

entry.title: Joule Setup for SAP Digital Manufacturing
entry.content:
We're excited to announce that Joule, SAP’s AI-powered enterprise copilot, is officially integrated into SAP Digital Manufacturing. This marks the first-ever availability of Joule in the Digital Manufacturing domain, enabling manufacturers to tap into intelligent, conversational insights right within their production environments 

SAP Digital Manufacturing is a suite of cloud-based and on-premise solutions that enables manufacturers to digitize, monitor, control, and optimise their production operations in real time. It integrates manufacturing processes with enterprise business systems, bridging the gap between ERP (like SAP S/4HANA) and shop floor operations, supporting Industry 4.0 and smart factory initiatives. 

Core Capabilities Supported Scope 

  • Production Execution 
  • Enterprise and Shop Floor Integration 
  • Visual Work Instructions 
  • Quality Management 
  • Manufacturing Analytics & KPIs (via DMi) 
  • Production Orchestration & Monitoring 
  • Resource and Material Management 
  • Edge Integration / IoT Enablement 
  • Sustainability & Compliance 

 

Supported Languages:  

Please refer to the link for most up to date information on languages supported by Joule.  

 please note to validate the data centers supported by Joule here.  

**************************************************************************************************************************

This blog post is a series for Joule Activation: 

  • SAP Business AI – Overview for all !!! (Includes information on Joule Supported Data Centers, Different scenarios during Joule setup, etc..) 
  • Joule - Unified Setup: Bridging Simplicity and Performance (Demo Video to understand the Unified Setup, Joule basics & architecture, how to set up Joule, etc...)  
  • Joule for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition - A Comprehensive Setup Guide 
  • Joule Setup – End-to-End Setup Guide (for all Line of Business) Unified Approach 
  • Joule for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition - Setup Guide 
  • SAP Digital Supply Chain 
  • Joule for SAP Integrated Business Planning (SAP IBP) – Setup Guide 
  • Joule – Getting Started with Document Grounding - setup guide 
  • Activate Joule with SAP Build Work Zone and SAP Mobile Start 
  • Analytics Insights in Joule – Setup Guide 
  • Joule in SAP Signavio Process Transformation Suite – Setup Guide 
  • Joule Setup for SAP Integrated Product Development 

Joule for SAP Digital Manufacturing  (You are Here) 

Blogs - Work in Progress (WIP): 

  • SAP SuccessFactors Joule Activation (Refer to SAP Discovery Centre) 
  • SAP Digital Supply Chain (WIP) 
  • SAP Asset Performance Management 
  • SAP Product Lifecycle Management 
  • SAP Concur 
  • SAP Ariba 
  • and more to be added towards General Availability 

This blog will uncover the steps to activate Joule in two different ways: Section (1): create a Joule SAP Digital Manufacturing as a standalone product (Fresh activation), Section (2): Activating and adding Joule SAP Digital Manufacturing with an existing subaccount along with your other activated / current LoBs landscape  

**************************************************************************************************************************

Scenario 

You want to integrate the generative AI copilot Joule with your SAP Digital Manufacturing application and require information about what to consider when you want to use Joule. 

Use Cases 

The following feature is available for Joule in SAP Digital Manufacturing: 

Conversational search of application help: Ask Joule questions about the SAP Digital Manufacturing apps and processes, and Joule gives you an answer based on the SAP Digital Manufacturing documentation from the SAP Help Portal.  

Pre-requisites 

  • Ensure that you meet all requirements for Joule onboarding. For more information, refer to Prerequisites in the Joule Onboarding Guide. 
  • You have an entitlement for Joule in the same global account on SAP BTP as your entitlement for SAP Digital Manufacturing. 
  • You have subscribed to SAP Digital Manufacturing. 

 

Integration Process: 

If you are activating Joule for the very first time for your SAP Digital Manufacturing system, then we refer to it as a standalone/single setup, as mentioned in “Section 1”.   

In this standalone setup process, you may decide to use the same SAP BTP Subaccount to activate Joule, or you may plan to use a new subaccount or if you would like to add SAP Digital Manufacturing to an existing subaccount and activate Joule that can be used which is a unified setup as described below in “Section 2”. 

What does Unified Setup mean? 

The unified setup of Joule with multiple SAP products allows business users to ask any question irrespective of the Joule client they are in. This approach helps avoid toggling between multiple applications, improves user efficiency, and delivers a more consistent, connected experience across all LoBs. 

Check your setup plan: 

By now, we hope you've selected one of the setup plans. Before we begin activating Joule for SAP Digital Manufacturing, let’s take a moment to understand how Joule works. 

image below explains how Joule works with your landscape integration 

Note: In the current release of Joule for DM, we do not use the SAP Build Work Zone and Cloud Foundry services. This is planned for the next releases.    

Now, since you have a clear understanding about Digital Manufacturing and how Joule works now it is time for us to start the integration process:  

Let us have a look at the steps involved for the integration: 

**************************************************************************************************************************

Integrating Joule  

  • Step 1: Setup Plan:  
    • Section 1: New Digital Manufacturing setup with no prior Joule setup. 
    • Section 2: You have an existing Joule subaccount, and you want to enable Joule for Digital Manufacturing 

*************************************************************************************************************************

Step 1: Setup Plan 

Section 1: New Digital Manufacturing setup with no prior Joule setup. 

If you already have some experience with SAP BTP (Business Technology Platform) we request you to follow the steps in this blog - Joule Setup – End-to-End Setup Guide (for all Line of Business) Unified Approach. In this blog, please check Section 2 (Check your SAP BTP Account for Joule Entitlements. 

If this is your first time using the SAP DM (Digital Manufacturing) platform and you're unsure how to proceed with the activation, don’t worry - we’ve got you covered. Just follow the steps below to activate Joule for SAP DM easily.  

Fresh Digital Manufacturing setup – no existing Joule configuration 

  1. Create the Subaccount and choose the relevant Data Centre 
  2. Set up Trust Configuration with SAP Cloud Identity Service 
  3. Add Entitlements 
  4. Run the Booster and Integrations with the Product SAP Digital Manufacturing 
    • Note: Choose the SAP Digital Manufacturing Test as product to enable Joule in your SAP Digital Manufacturing quality tenant. 
  5. Add the role “Joule_User” from the dmc application to a role collection 
    • Note: Assign those business users to the role collection that needs to interact with Joule. 
  6. Configure trusted domains in identity authentication for the SAP Digital Manufacturing domain 
    • Note: For more information, refer to Configure Trust to the Identity Authentication Tenant. 
  7. Configure a trusted domain in SAP BTP Cockpit for the same SAP Digital Manufacturing system
    • Note: For more information, refer to Configure Trusted Domain in SAP BTP. 
  8. Add the DM_USER User Role Collection to Launch the Joule
  9. See Joule in Action 

Step (1): Create the Subaccount and choose the relevant Data Centre 

Check this blog and follow step No – 5 

Check this blog and follow step No – 4 

Step (2): Set up Trust Configuration with SAP Cloud Identity Service 

Check this blog and follow step No – 7 

 

 

 

Step (3): Add Entitlements 

Check this blog and follow step No – 8  

 

 

Step (4): Run the Booster and Integrations with the Product SAP Digital Manufacturing 

The complete setup process is documented in this blog. Step No. 10 explains the process. For simplification, we have the simplified steps and images below.  

  • Click on Global Account -> Select Booster -> Search for Joule -> Run the Booster  

 

The system will validate the entitlements required. Once it’s green, you can click on Next  

Select the SAP BTP Subaccount and click on Next  

Select Integrations, you will be able to see the options for SAP IPD, select it, and click on Next  

 

 

Once you select the DM System, you can click on Next, review the selections, and click on Finish. The booster will take 5-9 minutes to activate Joule and set up the integrations with your DM system.  

Joule will now return the success message after the integrations are completed. You can validate this setup by navigating to Systems and Formation, searching for the Joule formation that will be created for your setup, as shown below.   

Step (5): Add the role “Joule_User” from the dmc application to a role collection 

  • After the booster run has completed and formation checks, add the role “Joule_User” from the dmc application to a role collection.  
  • Assign those business users to the role collection that needs to interact with Joule. 

Click on Subaccount -> Role Collections -> Create -> Joule_User -> Edit -> Role Name 

 

Step (6): Configure trusted domains in identity authentication for the SAP Digital Manufacturing domain 

  • For more information, refer to Configure Trust to the Identity Authentication Tenant. 

Open Cloud Identity Services -> click on Applications & Resources -> External Services -> Trusted Domains -> Add 

 

Step (7): Configure a trusted domain in SAP BTP Cockpit for the same SAP Digital Manufacturing system 

  • For more information, refer to Configure Trusted Domain in SAP BTP. 

Open Sub Account -> Security -> Settings -> Trusted Domains -> Add  

Step (8): Assign the role in Subaccount to launch the Joule 

Open Sub Account -> Security -> Role Collection > Create -> Add (DM_ROLE) 

 

 Step (9)  See Joule in Action

Congratulations on successfully setting up the SAP DM Standalone system!  

  
Now, let’s walk through how to add SAP DM to your existing subaccount alongside your other active Lines of Business (LoBs).  

Step 1: Setup Plan 

Section 2: You have an existing Joule subaccount, and you want to enable Joule for DM. In this option, we will show you how to activate DM in the context of an existing Joule formation. Within your SAP BTP Global Account, navigate to System Landscapes, click on Formations  

Search for the Joule formation you have already set up. In my case, “I am using one of the existing formations, which has multiple SAP products connected to one Joule instance, as shown below”. You can click on Include Systems.   

 

In the new window, filter for SAP Digital Manufacturing and click on Next step.   

 

Select the option “Enable Capability Deployment” and “Enable the Joule Icon in Integrated System” and click on Review 

 

Validate the selections and click on Include.   

The process may take 5 to 8 minutes to complete, and you should be able to see the synchronizing option, as shown image below. 

 

Once the status turns green and Ready, we are good to use Joule with Digital Manufacturing capabilities.  

Congratulations on successfully setting up SAP Digital Manufacturing with the Unified Approach! 

In a similar approach, you may use Joule with a unified experience in other SAP products that you have integrated in the same subaccount. 

If you have any questions about the setup, you can reach us at SAP_AI_RIG@sap.com  

Thank you for staying connected with our blog and successfully activating Joule for SAP Digital Manufacturing ! 

 
We hope you’ve had an exciting experience exploring the power of Joule, your intelligent business companion. From insightful decisions to streamlined processes, we trust you’re already seeing the incredible value Joule brings to your day-to-day work. 

Here’s smarter, faster, and more impactful outcomes powered by Joule! 🚀

entry.title: Free Joule Base! What does it mean for SAP's resellers?
entry.content:
Over the last months SAP has made several announcements related to making Joule free for customers.  In this article I will review the current status and share my thoughts on this topic and the opportunities for SAP channel partners.

My take on SAP making Joule Base free:   There are real costs involved for SAP to run Joule Base for customer.  When users query Joule SAP leverages LLMs to deal with the quiry and this has costs for SAP.  SAP does not pass this on to users.   But obviously, businesses don’t give away anything for free without a reason.  In my opinion, SAP has showed commitment to its statement that Joule will be the new UI of SAP solutions.  This is a strategic move for the future.    The core value and “crown jewel” of SAP is its automation of business processes, not the UI.  Making it easy and simple for customers to consume these core capabilities will make SAP’s core solutions more consumed and successful.  And that is where the important revenue streams for SAP are.

Joule is becoming more and more a platform.  Sometimes Joule is even called the AI OS of SAP.  Further, Joule and Joule agents also have the potential to leverage AI to integrate all the SAP solutions as needed, on the fly.  For many years people have said that  SAP solutions could be better integrated.  Perhaps Joule and Joule Agents will be a big step forward in this area?

Joule is becoming so central for SAP offerings and solutions that it makes sense to democratize it. 

What exactly do customers get for free?

Customers get “Joule Base” for free.  In my opinion, this is pretty much the “classic” Joule we heard about when SAP launched Joule last year.   Till now, Joule was available for some LOB solutions, but with limitation on how many free “Joule requests” a user was granted. And initially, transactional pattern was not included in the free Joule Base launched at Sapphire this year. However, transactional pattern is now included and there is no limit to the free requests / usage by the user.

With Joule Base users can leverage three types of activities (called Joule patterns): 

  • Navigational: ask a question in your own words related to what you want to do in the system and Joule will analyze your question together with LLMs and propose the best SAP app / screen for you to leverage.   Is these capabilities valuable for a user?  If a user always does the same activities and is an expert in the system, this might have limited value.  But if a user complain that SAP is difficult to work with this can absolutely help.  Also, for new users and existing users needing to do something new in the system the capabilities (together with informational pattern) can be very useful.  Finally, an interesting perspective from a channel partner always positioning Joule to customers and prospects: with the new generation of people joining the workforce, tools like Joule will become more and more important.  The new generation of workers expect to be able to get help from the systems they are supposed to use and master, instead of learning everything upfront.
  • Informational:  user can ask a question about how the SAP system works and Joule will leverage SAP help portal and the LLMs to provide an answer: the relevant sections from the help portal will be collected, passed on to the LLM with the appropriate prompt, and the LLM will make a summary for the specific question of the user.   For example, “what is the difference between a service order and a service contract”.   Other examples can be questions about how certain accounting principles works in SAP.   Further, a very interesting opportunity for customers is to extend this capability with information about their own work instructions, policies etc as part of document grounding.  In my opinion, the costing of SAP document grounding is very appealing for smaller customers.
  • Transactional:  While “navigational” and “informational” patterns are high level & general information about the SAP solution, transactional action is more about the customer specific business data in the system. Joule can retrieve data about specific business data information.  Example: “Show prices for sales organization 1710 that are due to expire before December 31, 2025”.   Joule can even change data in the system.  Instead of going to a specific app to do an action, a user can write in their own works instruction for joule to change the data.  For example: “Extend the valid-to dates by one week” (Joule will know you refer to the previous question about sales prices).   In my opinion, these capabilities can be valuable but are pretty “light” in terms of AI.  SAP Business AI can also do much more sophisticated & generative transactional actions in the system, but those activities have much higher run costs and is part of Premium AI offerings for which customers must pay extra.

 

Check out more on the AI commercialization on PE Portal

Joule runs on SAP BTP.  To run Joule Base, a customer thus needs to have an SAP BTP account. If a customer does not have an BTP account, they will get the needed entitlements for free.  

What are my opportunities as reseller when Joule base is free? 

If Joule Base is free, there is nothing to resell, right?  So, what is in it for resellers?   The topic is much more strategic than this.  SAP’s channel partners don’t only “resell stuff”, they also take care of customers to ensure they get the most out of their SAP system, that customers are happy about their SAP system, order more services from the partner and keep renewing their SAP subscriptions (for which partner also get paid).  AI is probably the biggest technology trend at the moment, and I think it is great that channel partners can tell their customers that SAP has invested a lot in R&D to ensure their systems and investment stay up to date with technology.  My recommendation to resellers is to position Joule Base part of what they get for their subscription payments and something which helps protect their investment in their SAP system.  

As partner, you can obviously do services around advising and implementing Joule Base for the customer.   And there are a lot of opportunities to do additional AI work for customers on top of Joule Base, including reselling AI Units which are needed to activate the Joule Premium packages.  And partners can leverage Joule Base to trigger ideas at customers request partner to develop customer specific AI capabilities.

What does customers NOT get with Joule Base?

There are basically three categories of capabilities customers don’t get and must pay extra for if they want to use them:

  • Joule Premium PUPM packages..  There are many deep/niche AI embedded capabilities which is only available in via Joule Premium packages.  Examples are  Financial business insight for ERP Cloud, Performance Goal creation in SuccessFactors and E-mail draft recommender for Service Cloud V2.   These capabilities go much deeper than Joule transactional capabilities and consume significant more LLM capacity.  Thus, these are charged separately.  These functionalities are triggers by users and thus included in the new Per User Per Month (PUPM) packages. 
  • Transactional Capabilities.  Finally, there are some AI powered capabilities not triggered by users, but by “the system”.  These capabilities are therefore priced based on a transactional metering.  Example of this is "Document Grounding": the upfront indexing of customer specific documents so that they can be leveraged by users (free) via joule base informational pattern later.
  • Analytical Pattern: There is a fourth Joule pattern only available in Joule Premium packages, and that is “Analytical Pattern”; the capability for Joule to respond to user prompts about analytical analysis of their SAP data.  Note: customers also need to run SAP Analytic Cloud (SAC) for this to work.  In general, this pattern has been developed by the central Joule team, but most of the LOB product teams still need to make the connection between Joule, LOB solution and SAC. So this pattern is not available yet for most LOB solutions.

What does a customer need to do to get Joule base for free?

While it is free, Joule Base is not automatically available for all customers.  The reason is there are specific AI terms and conditions which SAP wants customers to sign before they get access to Joule.  “Old” customers don’t have these T&C in their contract.  The easiest way for customers to get Joule Base is to “purchase ”Joule Base on the SAP store (at a cost of 0,00).   This will trigger the signing of the T&Cs and assignment of the entitlements in the customer’s system.

Can I as partner also get Joule Base for free for my TDD environment?

Yes.   For ERP Cloud, SuccessFactors, IBP and Digital Manufacturing, get it here for free for your LOB TDD system.  There is no TDD for ERP Cloud Private so there is also no Joule on TDD either.  However, this is planned to change in Q4 2025.  For CX, Joule is not in GA yet but expected to come later this year, also for TDD.

If you are interested in more details, check out these documents: 

ERP Cloud

ERP Cloud Private

SuccessFactors

Customer Experience

entry.title: AI-driven, Joule-enabled Warehouse Resource & Operations Management for SAP EWM on S/4 HANA 2023
entry.content:
It is a topic in every warehouse: Supervisors and Warehouse Operations Managers would like to see their planned workload for the day and see in real-time whether shipping times will be met. If shipping times are in jeopardy, the warehouse system is then expected to evaluate if an optimized resource allocation could pro-actively solve any potential delays. When a more optimal usage of the available resources is found, resources should automatically be directed to the critical areas. Being able to take action proactively is of the essence, because we do not want to only take action when we are already in delay.

The following is an example of an AI-driven, Joule enabled Application that can accomplish the above outlined requirements and activities supported by AI. The Application leverages the embedded AI in the EWM Private Cloud Edition S/4 HANA 2023 FPS03 release and the Joule Studio available in SAP Build.

 

 

The Architecture of the Application looks as follows:

 

AI-based Warehouse Workload Visibility

In the current version of the Application, the expected workloads of picking and packing operations are calculated leveraging the embedded AI capabilities in SAP EWM, which are then displayed in the UI5 Application (see in the example below):

It is also clearly visible in which Activity Area the workload is currently exceeding the planned Resource capacity.

The Application then further allows a manual simulation of adding or removing Resources to evaluate the impact in a given activity area. 

The fully "automatic rebalancing" function evaluates whether it is possible to optimize the resource allocation to the different areas, considering the allowed resource types in an Activity Area.

If an optimized resource allocation is possible, the warehouse operations manager, can accept these changes and the resources will be reassigned in the EWM system so that they will receive workload to execute from the new area.

Joule-enabled with custom EWM Joule Skills

Further more the current version of the Application provides Joule support for Warehouse Operations Management with the following Joule Skills:

- Joule Skill 1: Current Workload Analysis: Provide a comprehensive analysis of the current workload associated with picking and packing operations, considering the current resource allocation across different warehouse areas, as well as dependent scheduling of packing activities.
- Joule Skill 2: Provide Optimized Resource Allocation: Simulate an optimal workforce allocation strategy to mitigate bottlenecks and criticalities within the warehouse operations, to avoid shipping delays.
- Joule Skill 3: Accept Optimized Resource Allocation: Accept the optimization results and reassign the resources in EWM to the new areas.   

Coming soon an AI Agent will be introduce that autonomously orchestrates workforce allocation (monitored by the supervisor).

For more Information on this Application & AI functionality please contact SAP Services (EWMServices@sap.com).

entry.title: Joule for Developers with SAP BTP ABAP Environment-Setup Guide
entry.content:
Introduction:

On average, an SAP ABAP developer spends approximately 2 hours understanding the functional specification before beginning the coding process. Depending on the requirement, complexity, and the developer’s experience, he may take a day or two or more.

Over the years, every SAP customer has invested significant effort in custom developments, extensions, testing, and optimizing the code. Imagine if the developer is on vacation or has transitioned to a different project; in such cases, new code changes or updates become a considerable challenge for a new developer to manage.

From my years of SAP ABAP development experience, I have worked on several internal and customer requirements with few to many challenges understanding the code. With the introduction of AI in the current trend, SAP has been one of the front-runners in introducing AI capabilities. Let me take this opportunity to introduce you to SAP Joule for Developers (in short J4D).

“Joule” is the SAP copilot that ABAP developers need for their development tasks. It is uniquely trained on SAP data and processes. Joule's ABAP developer capabilities combine all the features to support full-stack development with ABAP Cloud. For instance, Joule provides real-time explanations of development objects, streamlining learning and finding answers to questions. Joule is fully integrated in the ABAP Development Tools for Eclipse and provides accurate information about currently opened development objects or marked lines of code. Joule is also able to predict and generate subsequent lines of code based on comments, or the code you're typing. The Joule code prediction takes the ABAP language version of your selected development object into account and suggests ABAP code that fits the respective language version context. Joule can generate ABAP cloud development scenarios, including all required development objects.

Why Joule for ABAP Developers:

The AI capabilities for ABAP are designed to enhance developer productivity by delivering new generative AI-powered assistance for frequent developer tasks. The ABAP AI capabilities utilize a purpose-built large language model (LLM) trained on 250 million lines of ABAP code to deliver the most precise, contextual results for ABAP workloads.

Benefits?

Joule can understand SAP development framework intricacies, anticipate developers’ needs, offer intelligent suggestions, and automate repetitive, mundane tasks like documentation and sample data generation. It can enable developers across pro-code and automation projects to be more productive, creative, and proficient in accelerating apps or extensions for business applications.

  • Predictive code completion based on context, comments, and project heuristics
  • Code explanations of core data services (CDS) view entities, classes, interfaces, and functional modules
  • AI-powered assistance for documentation, best practices, and new concepts
  • Boost developer productivity

Here is a glimpse of all the Joule for Developers(J4D) capabilities that it offers:

 

What license is required?

J4D is a part of SAP AI Unit (8019164), - the new Per User Per Month (PUPM) license model released by SAP for all requirements. However, we also have a limited offer with Joule for Developers (8019124) limited promotion, which is valid only until Q2 '2026. For more details on the limited option, please refer to the Blogpost and take a look at the SAP Note: 3571857.

Joule for developers ABAP AI capabilities is technically available in SAP BTP ABAP Environment and SAP S/4 HANA Cloud Public Edition after the upgrade to release 2502.

After purchasing the license:

  • SAP BTP ABAP Environment 
    All development tenants (where this license (8019164) is assigned/activated) in the corresponding SAP BTP Global Account are automatically enabled for the usage of Joule for developers, ABAP AI capabilities will show up only in one BTP Account where SKU is assigned.

Setup / Architecture diagram?

 

All requests to large language models are routed from ABAP to the AI foundation on SAP BTP. The use cases in the Accelerate category are managed by SAP. Once the subscription explained above is in place, the configuration part in your system is done automatically by SAP. Finally, update your ABAP Development Tools for Eclipse to the latest version using the link ADT version update to get the Joule integration in the IDE. Developers who shall be allowed to use Joule need the respective authorizations as explained in the documentation.

Use Cases: This documentation explains the ABAP development tools for Eclipse and refers to the range of functions that have been shipped as part of the standard delivery for the following products:

  • SAP BTP ABAP environment - If the user has ABAP SKU :8011136(Free), 8006181/8006182(Standard).  Use current blog steps to setup Joule for developers.                                                                                                                                                                                                           ABAP Service Plans-Service Plans and Metering for SAP BTP ABAP environment | SAP Help Portal, Know more-SAP Discovery Center Service - ABAP environment
  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition as of 2502- If the user doesn't have ABAP SKU as mentioned above, please use S/4 HANA PCE to setup Joule for Developers                                                                                                                                                                                                                   Setup Guide-Joule for Developer with SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition-Setup Guide - SAP Community

Help doc: ABAP Development Tools 2502 GA Doc

Pre-requisite:

  • SAP BTP (Administrator role within subaccount)
    •  Joule Entitlements - please refer to license topic
      • ABAP environment-Standard
      • Cloud foundry
    • SAP Cloud Identity Services

Discovery center use cases (ABAP): SAP Discovery Center Business AI Features

Roles and Authorizations

To be able to use Joule for developers, ABAP AI capabilities, your system administrator must assign you to a business role that contains the business catalogue SAP_A4C_BC_DEV_AIQ_PC.

Joule setup via SAP BTP (ABAP Environment).

Create a subaccount in your Global Account in SAP BTP.

 

 Enter a preferred Subaccount name, Select the region as per the Joule supported Data Centre and click on Create.

Help Doc (Data centers):

Entitlements

Under Entitlements: In this section, we add different service plans.

 Access Management:

Select Identity and access management from the dropdown:

Here, the User can add/delete the business roles.

 

 Add developer Role (SAP_BR_DEVELOPER) to the user: To access the ABAP developer functionalities.

Once, All the above steps have been incorporated, Goto ABAP Development Tool (latest version)

 

Create a new ABAP Cloud project:

 

Paste the URL Copied:

 Log on to the ABAP service instance:

 

 

Select the Default identity provider/ custom IDP created.

After you log in: Success message will appear.

Your project is created.

entry.title: Joule for Developers with SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition-Setup Guide
entry.content:
Introduction:

Typically, an SAP ABAP developer spends around two hours analyzing the functional specifications before diving into the actual coding. However, this time can vary significantly depending on the complexity of the requirement and the developer’s level of experience—ranging from a single day to several.

Over time, SAP customers have heavily invested in custom development, system enhancements, rigorous testing, and code optimization. This leads to a common challenge: when a developer goes on leave or transitions to another project, understanding and maintaining their code can become a daunting task for someone new.

Drawing from my own experience in SAP ABAP development, I’ve frequently encountered difficulties in interpreting legacy code—whether developed internally or for customers. In today's AI-driven landscape, SAP has taken bold steps to integrate artificial intelligence into its development ecosystem. One such innovation is SAP Joule for Developers (J4D).

Joule is more than just a digital assistant—it’s an AI copilot specifically designed to support ABAP developers. What sets Joule apart is that it's trained on SAP-specific data and processes, making it deeply contextual. It assists throughout the full-stack ABAP Cloud development lifecycle, offering features like real-time explanations of development objects, intuitive code insights, and instant answers to development-related queries.

Integrated directly into the ABAP Development Tools for Eclipse, Joule offers context-aware support for open development objects and selected lines of code. It also predicts and generates ABAP code in real-time based on your comments or what you’re typing. Importantly, it respects the language version of your development environment, ensuring that the suggestions align with the appropriate ABAP standards.

With Joule, developers can also generate complete ABAP Cloud development scenarios, including all necessary objects—significantly accelerating development and reducing the onboarding curve for new developers.

Why Joule for ABAP Developers:

The AI capabilities for ABAP are designed to enhance developer productivity by delivering new generative AI-powered assistance for frequent developer tasks. The ABAP AI capabilities utilize a purpose-built large language model (LLM) trained on 250 million lines of ABAP code to deliver the most precise, contextual results for ABAP workloads.

Benefits?

Joule can understand SAP development framework intricacies, anticipate developers’ needs, offer intelligent suggestions, and automate repetitive, mundane tasks like documentation and sample data generation. It can enable developers across pro-code and automation projects to be more productive, creative, and proficient in accelerating apps or extensions for business applications.

  • Predictive code completion based on context, comments, and project heuristics
  • Code explanations of core data services (CDS) view entities, classes, interfaces, and functional modules
  • AI-powered assistance for documentation, best practices, and new concepts
  • Boost developer productivity

 

  What license is required?

. However, we also have a limited offer with Joule for Developers (8019124) limited promotion, which is valid only until Q2 '2026. For more details on the limited option, please refer to the Blogpost and take a look at the SAP Note: 3571857.

After purchasing the license:

  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition -ABAP Environment 
    License (8019164) is assigned/activated, please be aware that it may take up to 24h after the process finished until all Joule for developers, ABAP AI capabilities are fully usable

Setup / Architecture diagram?

 

  • Joule is a software component, offered as Software-as-a-Service (managed, updated by SAP)​
  • Joule runs technically on the SAP Business Technology Platform​
  • A central, single “productive” tenant of Joule is recommended​
  • It can be instantiated multiple times, while a subaccount translates to a tenant. E.g. in case customers want to have a sandbox installation, or a separated dedicated Joule​
  • Respective tenants of SAP solutions (SAP SFSF, SAP S/4HANA Cloud) will then be “integrated” with a Joule tenant, manual process (“opt-in”)​
  • The Joule UI (Joule Web Client) appears then embedded within a frame within the connected SAP solution​
  • E.g. in case Joule is already set-up for SFSF the S4HANA system can simply be added to it!​
  • A central Joule tenant requires a “unified Identity and Access Management” (same IAS tenant for all connected SAP solutions)​
  • Current limitation: only 1 S/4HANA (Public/Private) tenant can be connected to a Joule tenant

 Finally, update your ABAP Development Tools for Eclipse to the latest version using the link ADT version update to get the Joule integration in the IDE. Developers who shall be allowed to use Joule need the respective authorizations as explained in the documentation.

Use Cases: This documentation explains the ABAP development tools for Eclipse and refers to the range of functions that have been shipped as part of the standard delivery for the following products:

  • SAP BTP ABAP environment - If the user has ABAP SKU :8011136(Free), 8006181/8006182(Standard).  Refer to Following blog steps to setup Joule for developers: Joule for Developers with SAP BTP ABAP Environment-Setup Guide - SAP Community            ABAP Service Plans-Service Plans and Metering for SAP BTP ABAP environment | SAP Help Portal, Know more-SAP Discovery Center Service - ABAP environment
  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition as of 2502- If the user doesn't have ABAP SKU as mentioned above, please refer to current S/4 HANA PCE Blog to setup Joule for Developers                     

Help doc: ABAP Development Tools 2502 GA Doc

 Pre-requisite:

Please follow the following process to enable Joule for developers, ABAP AI capabilities in the development instance(s):

  • Logon to SAP for Me.
  • Under Dashboards, please choose Services & Support.
  • On the tab Service Requests, choose the New Service Request button.
  • The system displays the New Service Request dialog. Choose the radio button Partner & Other Cloud Services.
  • On the service request home page, choose the Create Service Request button.
  • Search for "Toggle Joule for developers, ABAP AI capabilities" and then open the service request.
  • Use the service request to toggle the Joule for developers, ABAP AI capabilities and find the actual toggle status therein.

      Please be aware that it may take up to 24h after the process finished until all Joule for developers, ABAP AI capabilities are fully usable

        Discovery Center use cases (ABAP): SAP Discovery Center Business AI Features

Roles and Authorizations

To be able to use Joule for developers, ABAP AI capabilities, your system administrator must assign you to a business role that contains the business catalogue SAP_A4C_BC_DEV_AIQ_PC.

Joule setup via SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition:

Goto SAP For Me: me.sap.com

Under that go to System & Provisioning tab:

 

 Under public cloud systems:

Goto system with development system role and SAP S/4 HANA Cloud service:

 

click on instance, then click on launch URL:

 Your development system looks like:

Goto Identity and access management:

Maintain Business role:

Add SAP_BR_DEVELOPER Role to your user: To access the ABAP developer functionalities.

 

 

Copy the URL from the homepage:

 

Goto ABAP development tools (Latest version):

Click on create new project, Then Select ABAP Cloud Project:

Paste the URL copied from above:

 Log on to the ABAP service instance:

Select the Default identity provider/ custom IDP created.

Help doc: How to setup a Customer IDP

After you log in: Success message will appear.

Your project is created.
